title: Wingate faces test over loan book and Ruby sale
text:
Private lender Wingate has raised $200 million for its consumer lending division NOW FINANCE as a potential sale of part of its property loan book makes its rounds in the rumour mill.

While the Melbourne-based finance house said its consumer lending placement of $200 million was oversubscribed, it denied it was looking to sell part of its property loan book.

Ralan's Ruby project on the Gold Coast. Supplied

Private lenders which focused on more institutional clients as opposed to Wingate's staple of high-net-worth investors said they had been quietly approached by Wingate to run the rule over a potential purchase. It is understood Wingate funders were looking to redeem their funds.

Wingate faces another test when bids close next week for the proposed sale of the remaining three towers at collapsed developer Ralan Group's Ruby project on the Gold Coast. Wingate was one of the funders of the Ruby project.

The 1600-unit project is now the subject of a voluntary administration following Ralan's collapse in August.
description: Wingate said its consumer lending placement of $200 million was oversubscribed but denied it was looking to sell part of its property loan book.
